Class Radar

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.InGameObject
      • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Radar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Radar
extends InGameObject
    Author:
    Richard Pham, Oakar Kyaw, Ethan Liao, Jeremy Anunwah, Bennett Wong.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean turnOnRadar
      This field represents the switch of radar powerup.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Radar()
      The default constructor for the radar class.
      Radar(int row, int column)
      This constructor will take in a row and column position, and will use those in the InGameObject constructor t set it to a desired position on the board.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getRadar()
      This method returns whether or not the radar is turned on or off.
      void setRadar()
      This method will set the radar to be turned on (true).

    • Field Detail

      • turnOnRadar

        private boolean turnOnRadar
        This field represents the switch of radar powerup. It will be initially set to be false or turned off.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Radar

        public Radar()
        The default constructor for the radar class. The constructor will call the InGameObject constructor and set the position to be outside the board, with it being turned off.

      • Radar

        public Radar(int row,
             int column)
        This constructor will take in a row and column position, and will use those in the InGameObject constructor t set it to a desired position on the board.
        Parameters:
        row - the desired row position.
        column - the desired column position.

    • Method Detail

      • setRadar

        public void setRadar()
        This method will set the radar to be turned on (true).

      • getRadar

        public boolean getRadar()
        This method returns whether or not the radar is turned on or off.
        Returns:
        whether the radar is currently turned on or not.
